original_title: Govt. intends resolving construction industry issues: Sagala
original_body_lines: The construction sector’s problems will be addressed gradually as the country’s financial situation improves, said the Chief of Presidential Staff and Senior Adviser on National Security to the President Sagala Ratnayake said.
He made this statement during the meeting of the working committee on interest rates and bank recovery measures to uplift the construction sector, held on Tuesday.
In light of the current economic crisis, the financial problems confronting the construction industry, as well as the steps to be taken in this regard, were discussed at length.
Ratnayake also stated that it is the Government’s expectation to provide solutions to all the problems that have arisen in the construction sector.

The current state of the financial sector was explained by Treasury Secretary Mahinda Siriwardena and Central Bank Governor Dr. Nandalal Weerasinghe. This discussion was attended by Committee members, including Presidential Adviser on Economic Affairs Dr. R.H.S. Samaratunga.
